history.content:
Math 113 is a pretty big step up from the likes of Math 54 and 53. Math 110 is usually recommended as a smoother transition into proof-based upper div math.

--------

I would actually disagree with the previous answer--I think 113 is a much better first upper div than 110.  I think when I took it, about half the class hadn't taken anything upper division before, so the class ends up being somewhat geared towards that.

That being said, your experience in 113 will depend highly on which professor you take it with.  You should especially keep this in mind since you can't phase 1 it (due to the new math department rules outlined in @5161), so by the time you're able to sign up, you're likely to be left with professors that are...less popular.  Looking in to what people have said about their classes in the past will probably be a good idea.

--------

If you haven't taken CS 70/Math 55 yet, you won't really be able to do anything in Math 113. UD math courses are all proof-based, meaning without at least basic proof maturity, you won't really know how to do the problems in 113, or understand what's going on.

They are VERY different from the likes of 1A/B, 53/54.

children.subject: I suggested Math 110 first due to the fact that the math department website recommends it, and in addition most feedback from the Berkeley mathematics fb page says the same. I personally found 110 to be by far the easiest upper division, and the proofs were far shorter than those in say math 104 and math 113. And yes, there are often many insanely challenging professors who teach 113

history.content:
Hello! I am a first year undergrad planning to take the above schedule next semester.

What do you guys think the difficulty will be like?

For reference, I am in 61A right now, and its very easy (on route to A+/A), Data 8 which is a even easier (on route to A), and Math 54 which isn't super easy, but makes a lot of conceptual sense (on route to A-).

I've also been exposed to proofs and had a lot of programming experience from highschool + looooove math. Taken Math 53 equivalent and 5+ previous CS courses.

How manageable (or unmanageable) will the schedule above be? Would it be about twice as difficult as my current schedule? Any tips for Math 113/Stat 140.

THANKS!!!!!!
history.subject: CS 61B + STAT 140 + MATH 113 Diffficulty?
